ngiemboon: Atáa manzwě áa těen maga wɔ́.

en: You gave him until he ate.

ngiemboon: À tǒ tà ńtyé ncwò ndá.
en: He came so far as to stand at the door.

ngiemboon: Tà mé pfó tàʼ sàga nzsè.
en: Let's not take the long way.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n da gɔɔn né yé, á tǎ ńgʉa ńkẅé.
en: I told him, then he went to pick it up.

ngiemboon: À gɔ̌ɔn, tà á kuʼ, á lu ssé ńgʉa.
en: After saying that, he got up to leave.

ngiemboon: Gÿo mmó gie n gɔ̌ɔn ngie ɔ̀ gÿo, tà á té púʼu wɔ́ mbà ɔ̀ ge lʉa.
en: Do what I asked you to do, otherwise you will cry.

ngiemboon: Tóo ńkaa lʉŋ yɔɔn tà mbà yɛ̂ ńdɔg ńtó.
en: Come carry this chair and even this one to bring.

ngiemboon: Náa mmó m pfɛ́ tà mbà n ge cúa ɔ́.
en: Give me something to eat or I'll beat you up.

ngiemboon: Gʉa ḿbÿé múɔ mbwo metá pú, tà mbɔ̌ melyè pú.
en: Go and announce the birth of the baby to your parents and your brothers.

ngiemboon: Tá pà má we nyé wó.
en: His maternal grandfather is still living.

ngiemboon: À nǎ nkẅíŋ né tá pà tá we.
en: He gave the wood to his grandfather.

ngiemboon: Tá pà tɔɔn ndÿò ne ńguɔ tɛʼ.
Tá we pɔ́ má we ée mbʉ̀a.
À ka gʉa ḿbÿé múɔ mbwo tá we ndÿo.
en: He went to announce the newborn to his grandfather.
